title: League doesn't have a Warlock ala Gul'dan, unless I'm mistaken
body:
Swain is the closest we have, but doesn't quite have "Warlock" in his design. Besides, he's slated for a VGU, AFAIK.

Gul'dan is one of my favorites right now in Heroes of the Storm because of his high damage, but also because his Life Tap mechanic is so unique for a MOBA. You don't regenerate mana normally, but pay a portion of your health to recover it. I imagine this wouldn't be doable in the exact same way in League due to the tech limitations (D key is reserved for Summoner Spells, for one), but it'd be cool to have Warlock mechanics in LoL.

Not to mention that Runeterra could always use a Chaos Mage.

replies.body: i always thought karthus as the stereotype warlock of league

Fiddlesticks

But yeah, I don't think Riot wants to make a champion focused on DoTs.
Fiddlesticks always reminded me of WoW Warlocks, to an extent. Fear, life drain, janky death aesthetic. Dunno how Gul'Dan handles in HOTS, I haven't played it.
Oh, he's great. He has Fiddle's life drain, though it costs no mana, a spammable cone AOE, and an AOE Fear ult, to name a few things. He's also just sheer evil, and I love it.
Such a champ would be gimped by GW.
Swain will probably be reworked into more of a warlock.
